Class CoalesceWithNoiseAction

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.AbstractAction
      visualcryptography.CoalesceWithNoiseAction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.Action
 class CoalesceWithNoiseAction
extends javax.swing.AbstractAction

CoalesceAction class is responsible in making the coalesce image from the n shares specified. This action retains the noise for visual printing purposes.

Since:
6.25.05
Author:
Edward P. Legaspi

Submit a bug or feature at laizzez_faire07(@)yahoo.com. Visual Cryptography is an implementation of the newly discovered and developed visual encryption algorithm by Naor and Shamir at the Eurocrypt 1994. Copyright 2005 University of the Philippines, Los Ba±os, Laguna. All rights reserved.
